conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_C and for applying again.

At this time, we are not able to extend an offer because we must continue reserving our remaining seat for higher-priority candidates on our list (Student_D, Student_E, Student_A, and Student_B) who may still apply in upcoming rounds.

Regarding your question: we do keep track of your repeated applications and strong intent to enroll, but we cannot make any commitment to treat any applicant as a guaranteed “immediate fallback” while higher-priority candidates may still enter. If we reach the later stages of the process and our seat is still unfilled with no higher-priority candidates able to take it, we would reassess then.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_C is last on our true priority list. We have quota 1 and remain unmatched; higher-priority students (D, E, A, B) could still apply in later rounds. Accepting C now would block us from matching with any of those higher-priority candidates, which is against our objective. Therefore we should reject while signaling they remain a fallback only if the process nears the end with no higher-priority applicants materializing.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m Student_C. I’m applying again this round because School_C remains my top remaining choice. If you offer me the seat, I will accept immediately and withdraw from all other options.

Given that we are now in round 13 and School_C is the only school still unmatched, I respectfully ask that you consider whether any higher-priority candidates are realistically still able to take your seat. If not, I would be grateful if you could finalize the offer to me now so the seat does not remain unfilled.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my 2nd true choice, so I should continue applying. Past rejections indicate School_C is holding the seat for higher-priority students who might still apply. To maximize my chance, I will submit a clean, formal [APPLY] reiterating immediate commitment, while also asking them to consider that many higher-priority students likely already matched elsewhere given only School_C is left unmatched. I will keep the message concise and respectful to avoid annoyance while signaling urgency as rounds advance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your continued patience and for reaffirming that you will enroll immediately if admitted.

Given where we are in the process and our goal of ensuring the seat is filled, we are prepared to extend you an offer of admission to School_C at this time.

Please confirm your acceptance per the process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is last on our true priority list, and we have repeatedly rejected them to preserve the seat for higher-priority students (D, E, A, B). However, by round 13 the user states School_C is the only unmatched school, implying the other students likely matched elsewhere and are no longer available to apply. Since no higher-priority candidate is in the current inbox and the risk of ending unfilled is rising, accepting Student_C now dominates continuing to hold out, given we prefer filling with an included student over leaving empty and Student_C is included (though lowest).
